52 Vita sancti Marci ewangeliste.
SEint Marc, þe holie godspellare : wide wende in londe
For-to prechi cristine-dom : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes sonde.
In egypte he prechede longue : and sethþe at þen ende
Into þe lond of Alisaundre : þannes he gan i-wiende.
Þo he into Alisaundre cam : his on newe scho
with-oute hurtingue of ani-þing : gan to berste a-two.
Þo was þis guode man of-drad : longue he stod in þou&yogh;t,
And seide, "mi porpos and mi wei : is nouþe to ende i-brou&yogh;t!
&YOGH;if it mi louerdes wille were : þat he me wolde þane deth sende,
Ich am redi his wille a-fongue : &yogh;wodere[al. & wh.] he wole þat ich[al. to] wiende."
he wende forth to a soutere : &yogh;if he is scho makie mi&yogh;te.
Þe soutare atþe furste stiche : ful vuele is hond he p[r]i&yogh;te.[MS. pi&yogh;te]
Sori and wroth þis soutare was : for him smert so sore.
Seint Marc bi-gan to prechi þo : and tolde him of godes lore,
And bad him bi-lieue on Iesu crist : and cristine-dom vnder-fongue,
And he is hond hele wolde : þat i-hurt was so strongue.
Seint Marc with is spottle : watte a luyte vrþe on þe grounde
And þare-with he smeorede his sore hond : and heo werth hol in a stounde.
Þe soutere, and alle his, bi-gonne þo : and euerech þat in þe strete cam,
to bi-lieue on crist, godes sone : and a-fenguen cristine-dam.â€”
Seint Marc &yogh;eode wide in londe : to prechi godes lawe.
Þe prince of þe londe it onder-&yogh;at : and þou&yogh;te to don him of dawe.
he liet him seche into al þat lond : and þo he him hadde i-founde,
"Ich hote eov," he seide to is men : "þat he beo faste i-bounde[v. 24 corrupted.]
For-to he to þe prisone come : and þare-inne &yogh;e him caste a-non."
Ouer-al is flechs was to-drawe : ri&yogh;t to þe bare bon,
with Irene crokes,as men him drowe : þe mosseles lei&yogh;en wel grete;
And al blodie weren of is blod : þe stones in þe strete.
A-ni&yogh;t, ase he in prisone lai : ore louerd to him cam,
In fourme þat he on eorþe was : þo he manhede nam;
"Marc," he seide, "beo wel glad : and &yogh;arkne þe wel bliue,
For þi name is i-write : in eche boke of liue :[al. in þe b. of eche l.]
Þov schalt to-morewe for mi loue : soffri deth wel stronge[MS. stronde]
And sethþe mine blisse of heouene : with-outen ende a-fongue."
Seint Marc þonkede ore louerd ful &yogh;eorne : ase he[al. and] in his bedes lay.
A-morewe þe prince him liet up fette : sone so it was dai.
A strong rop he liet nime : and a-boute is swere binde,
And teiden[r. teien] him sethþe to a wilde hors : at þe taile bi-hinde;
he liet him drawe þoru&yogh; al þe toun : þat ech lime fram oþer wende.
Þus seint Marc þe holie man : his soule to ore louerd sende.
In þe Monþe of Aueril þis was. : men scholden faste is eue;
Ake for þe hei&yogh;e feste of eastur-dai : men it doth bi-leue.
his dai men fastez þoru&yogh; al þat lond : for him-seolf nis it nou&yogh;t,
Ake for reuerence of þe baneres : [þat] in þat dai beoth fort i-brou&yogh;t.
For men berez heom eche &yogh;ere a-boute : ase red is þare-of i-nome,[vv. 45-50 om. in most MSS. (except MS. Vernon).]
to bidden for þe eorþe blede : þat it mote wel forth come.
Men fastez, &yogh;wane huy formest berez heom out : a-seint Marcus dai þare-fore,
And þreo dawes a-&yogh;ein halewe-þoresday : &yogh;wane huy bez forþer i-bore.
bidde we nouþe seint Marc : &yogh;was lijf we habbez i-heord to þe ende,
Þat ore soule mote þoru&yogh; his Arndingue : into heouene i-wiende.
